sandypython.utils¶

class sandypython.utils.DeactivateSandbox[source]¶

Context manager which will call sandypython.core.end_sandbox() if the sandbox was started, then sandypython.core.start_sandbox() if it ended it. It is save to use this without activating the sandbox before hand (it will be a no-op).

Example:

with utils.DeactivateSandbox:
    open("f.txt")
    import sys
class sandypython.utils.ActivateSandbox[source]¶

Context manager which will call sandypython.core.start_sandbox() if the sandbox has not been started, then sandypython.core.end_sandbox() if it started it. It is save to use this with the sandbox already started (it will be a no-op).

Example:

with utils.ActivateSandbox:
    core.exec_str(bad_code)
